text: He stuck the key in the hole and twisted.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne pushed and the door swung inward with a tremendous groan.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne and Sean stared down into a long, dark passage.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne turned his finger in a circle and whispered a prayer to Friva.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean took a torch from the wall and handed it to Kyne.
Name: Book 28

text: Then he grabbed one for himself.
Name: Book 28

text: Go on, said Sean.
Name: Book 28

text: Gulping, Kyne moved forward.

frame.Frame: Cause change of position on a scale

Name: Book 28

text: As soon as the light of the torch struck the dark passage, the walls came alive with sparkling light.
Name: Book 28

text: The material here seemed to be the same smooth, glassy stonework found in the Violenese construction of Frivas Hall of Feasts.
Name: Book 28

text: Furthermore, it seemed covered with a permanent layer of safra, twinkling all around them with radiance.
Name: Book 28

text: If not for the floor under their feet, Sean would have thought they walked through a midnight sky, thick with glowing stars.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne had come to a stop again.
Name: Book 28

text: Seans voice boomed through the passage followed by a hundred echoes.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne had little choice but to obey.
Name: Book 28

text: They kept walking downward for an imperceptible amount of time.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean felt that his breath was ragged, his muscles weary, though he couldnt explain why.
Name: Book 28

text: He felt parched from his mouth to his throat.
Name: Book 28

text: His eyes burned and he wished desperately to pull out his lenses.
Name: Book 28

text: Perhaps he would soon.
Name: Book 28

text: Soon, it wouldnt matter anyway.
Name: Book 28

text: Look, said Kyne, pointing further downward.
Name: Book 28

text: Do you see it.
Name: Book 28

text: Indeed, far down the spiraling blackness of the passage, a soft white light glowed below.
Name: Book 28

text: They kept moving towards it, though Seans feelings of dread increased.
Name: Book 28

text: Whatever strange power lurked below, it seemed a far cry from any with which he was familiar.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne walked into the light first, gasping with awe as he entered an open chamber.
Name: Book 28

text: The torches were entirely unnecessary here.
Name: Book 28

text: Stone columns thrust from the floor ending with white, glowing crystals.
Name: Book 28

text: The crystals grew organically from the stone, their inward light rippling like veins through the columns themselves.
Name: Book 28

text: Within the pillars was a round platform, etched with intricate designs of snakes, tigers, and wolves like the door to the dungeons.
Name: Book 28

text: Around all this, the chamber opened up and outward in a dome-like shape.
Name: Book 28

text: A hole at the top led up into the earth, and probably eventually to the heavens above.
Name: Book 28

text: All around the platform, piles of safra dust glittered in the light.
Name: Book 28

text: I didnt expect it to be so beautiful, breathed Kyne.
Name: Book 28

text: Ignoring the prince, Sean moved past, dragging the bundle onto the open platform.
Name: Book 28

text: It seemed like the most obvious place to put it.
Name: Book 28

text: Next he unwrapped the tapestry and pushed the bodies onto the stone.
Name: Book 28

text: WaitI didnt tell you to do that yet.
Name: Book 28

text: Do you have a better suggestion.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne scowled at him.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean finished, then threw the tapestry aside.
Name: Book 28

text: As quickly as he could, he got off the platform.
Name: Book 28

text: Something about standing on it made him uncomfortable.
Name: Book 28

text: He stood fidgeting, finding it impossible to stay still.
Name: Book 28

text: His muscles twitched and his stomach growled.
Name: Book 28

text: What next.
Name: Book 28

text: he snapped.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne set down his torch and unrolled the Safra Script with trembling fingers.
Name: Book 28

text: I know we have to burn the bodies.
Name: Book 28

text: But Im not sure if I say the words before or after.
Name: Book 28

text: Burn them.
Name: Book 28

text: said Sean.
Name: Book 28

text: After all the mystery, this seemed like such a simple solution.
Name: Book 28

text: He couldnt believe that was all there was to it.
Name: Book 28

text: Try saying the words first, just in case.
Name: Book 28

text: Yeah.
Name: Book 28

text: I guess youre right.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne held the script up to the light and proceeded with a tremulous voice.
Name: Book 28

text: His tongue stumbled over the strange and unknown syllables.
Name: Book 28

text: Tula trein devoro dil Bargind margis, ganza devrein di Friva kisten regla scritept dil Violinese bloodor, Kyne Violeni.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean felt as if a shock went through him.
Name: Book 28

text: He stumbled back to the wall and remained there, clutching it.
Name: Book 28

text: He watched as the light of the crystals brightened, then splintered into differing shades of color.
Name: Book 28

text: Illumination poured through the columns and lit the platform with divine light.
Name: Book 28

text: The blood of the bodies sizzled and smoked against the phosphorescence.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean didnt know how, but he had understood every word from Kynes mouth.
Name: Book 28

text: As the three gods of the Bargain have agreed, let the power of Friva pay heed to the words of the Violenese progeny, Kyne Violeni.
Name: Book 28

text: Unaware of Seans discomfort, Kyne continued with his awkward speech.
Name: Book 28

text: Unz, ganza ignickun di Belazar yollee frem u devorgan.
Name: Book 28

text: White flames erupted from the platform and crept over the bodies.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean groaned and curled inward.
Name: Book 28

text: His muscles twitched and his eyes felt as if they were on fire.
Name: Book 28

text: Something wasnt right.
Name: Book 28

text: First may the flames of Belazar rise forth to consume you, Kyne had said.
Name: Book 28

text: Krenzi u morde.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean yelled and clawed at his eyes.
Name: Book 28

text: He ripped the brown lenses off, one by one, then flung them to the floor.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne turned to look at him, his teeth chattering with fear.
Name: Book 28

text: On the platform, the white hot flames crept on the dead bodies, searing their clothes and flesh.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean could almost feel what the flames did, as if their hot touch sent a signal through his own fingers.
Name: Book 28

text: The flesh they consumed was supposed to be warm and full of sensation, not cold and dead.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean groaned and fell to his knees.
Name: Book 28

text: He clawed at his hair, as if that would make the terrible feeling in his fingers go away.
Name: Book 28

text: Theyre supposed to be alive, he growled at last.
Name: Book 28

text: Theyre supposed to be alive.
Name: Book 28

text: I.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne seemed on the verge of hyperventilating, himself.
Name: Book 28

text: I dont know what else to do.
Name: Book 28

text: I should finish, at least.
Name: Book 28

text: He licked his lips and turned back to the script.
Name: Book 28

text: Krenzi u morde, solu dil hapya, eedor copa shaporinz dil frivol koren donu.
Name: Book 28

text: Cross the line into oblivion, souls of the hapless, while your bodies take the shape of the joy stolen from you.
Name: Book 28

text: You  fucking  idiot.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean rushed forth, grabbed Prince Kyne, and flung him to the stony floor.
Name: Book 28

text: Billows of loose safra flew from their struggling shapes.
Name: Book 28

text: The heat of the hungry flames singed their skin with its intensity.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean pinned Kyne and looked down at him.
Name: Book 28

text: He knew his eyes blazed as red as ever, for he could now see with the full strength of a Wolvenand perhaps Belazar himself.
Name: Book 28

text: He could see the veins flowing under Kynes skin.
Name: Book 28

text: He could feel the hastening beat of his heart.
Name: Book 28

text: He could smell the wave of fear rushing from him as he stared into the eyes of his killer.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne started to scream.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean clamped his mouth easily with one hand.
Name: Book 28

text: With the other, he pulled a throwing star from his tunic.
Name: Book 28

text: The prince thrashed and tried to bite Seans hand with his teeth, to no avail.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean closed his eyes and took a deep breath.
Name: Book 28

text: Now, at last, he would get the relief he desired.
Name: Book 28

text: Tula margis, he said, afithi fenturus zentaya.
Name: Book 28

text: He swept the blade across Kynes throat.
Name: Book 28

text: He held the prince down through his most desperate writhing to the moment he went still.
Name: Book 28

text: He dipped his fingers in the blood, then licked the sweet redness away.
Name: Book 28

text: Kyne Violeni, krenzi u morde ah Belazar.
Name: Book 28

text: Prickling heat spread through Seans limbs.
Name: Book 28

text: At the same time, the white flames of the platform snuffed out.
Name: Book 28

text: Darkness filled the chamber but for the faint red light of the torches.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean breathed raggedly as Belazar moved through him, taking what Sean had promised him.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean closed his eyes and saw a wall of golden flames lick the blackness of his eyelids.
Name: Book 28

text: A wolf with fur like tar walked through the blaze, its eyes glowing red.
Name: Book 28

text: The wolf looked at Sean, and Sean knew he had a choice.
Name: Book 28

text: Belazar was pleased with him.
Name: Book 28

text: No words were needed for Sean to understand this.
Name: Book 28

text: He could see it in the wolfs gaze, though the wolf made no sound.
Name: Book 28

text: I feared you would disappoint me, the wolf seemed to say.
Name: Book 28

text: But you gave me what I most desired.
Name: Book 28

text: Now only one remains.
Name: Book 28

text: Promise her to me, Sean Wolven, and I will give you the whole of my power.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean blinked away the vision.
Name: Book 28

text: He shook his head, swallowed the blood, and felt as if a bucket of cold water dashed over him.
Name: Book 28

text: The sight of the wolf went away, and the cold black of the chamber rushed in to replace it.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean stood up with Kynes dead body in his arms.
Name: Book 28

text: The weight of it surprised him; while he still possessed unusual strength, it was not the power to rip off metal with his bare hands, or drag five dead bodies without feeling any strain.
Name: Book 28

text: He felt the weariness of all he had done since last night, combined with the exhaustion of having no sleep or food.
Name: Book 28

text: He tossed Kynes body onto the platform with the others.
Name: Book 28

text: He pulled the key from Kynes neck and stuffed it into his tunic.
Name: Book 28

text: Then he picked up the torch and set the bodies ablaze.
Name: Book 28

text: There was nothing divine about the flames now consuming the corpses.
Name: Book 28

text: Thick black smoke arose from their curling clothes and bubbling flesh.
Name: Book 28

text: A terrible stench rolled out of the conflagration.
Name: Book 28

text: No Haze would come out of this fire: only the stink of rotting flesh.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean picked up the Safra Script, considering what to do with it.
Name: Book 28

text: By keeping it, he could help save Dearen.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayr could learn her ancestors secret and maintain the precious Haze.
Name: Book 28

text: But was that what she really wanted to do.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayr despised safra to begin with, and if not, she would despise it even more when she realized how to make it.
Name: Book 28

text: The decision would be painful no matter what she chose.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean could spare her from that anguish.
Name: Book 28

text: The Wolven smashed the script into a ball and flung it into the fire.
Name: Book 28

text: Then he turned and walked out of the dungeons, hoping never to return.
Name: Book 28

text: * Sean had not walked far from the dungeons when he came face to face with Picard.
Name: Book 28

text: They stood on the Bridge of Roses, connecting the central stone fortress of the palace to a section of domed towers.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean planned to climb them to reach the eastern gate and thus get to his horse.
Name: Book 28

text: As of now, they stood only two stories above ground, for Sean had climbed one stairway from the door to the dungeons.
Name: Book 28

text: The bridge was wide open, lined only with low railing that bristled with thorny rose bushes.
Name: Book 28

text: Picard stood with a group of about ten hordesfolk behind him, blocking the bridge completely.
Name: Book 28

text: Where are you off to, Seanie.
Name: Book 28

text: said Picard.
Name: Book 28

text: Actually, you should be glad you came this way.
Name: Book 28

text: If youd gone through the other hallway, you would have run into Richard.
Name: Book 28

text: Now, you and I have a chance to speak reason with one another.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean groaned and grabbed the railway.
Name: Book 28

text: A thorn nicked his finger.
Name: Book 28

text: He didnt have time for this.
Name: Book 28

text: It was almost high noon, and he needed to get out of here.
Name: Book 28

text: He looked out at the city of Dearen, amazed by how dirty it looked without the Haze to cover it with mist.
Name: Book 28

text: Some of its filth was disguised by soft layers of safra, coating everything with sparkles.
Name: Book 28

text: The sky, also, shone with exceptional beauty.
Name: Book 28

text: Shades of deep blue contrasted sharply with wispy white clouds and rays of white sunlight striking through them.
Name: Book 28

text: It was as if a god from heaven brushed the landscape with fingers of light.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean realized belatedly that hed been standing there awhile, staring at the sky and catching his breath.
Name: Book 28

text: A cruel glimmer entered Picards blue eyes.
Name: Book 28

text: Why, Seanie, you look tired.
Name: Book 28

text: I also see that youve misplaced your brown lenses.

text: Is everything all right.
Name: Book 28

text: I killed Prince Kyne, said Sean hoarsely.

text: My assignment is over.
Name: Book 28

text: You can pay me later.
Name: Book 28

text: Right now, I must go.
Name: Book 28

text: Oh.
Name: Book 28

text: The smile on Picards face faltered.
Name: Book 28

text: Is that all you have to tell me.
Name: Book 28

text: I was unable to complete the other assignment, said Sean.
Name: Book 28

text: He stiffened and turned slightly.

text: He heard the jangle of several men coming up the steps behind him, though it would be a little while before they arrived.
Name: Book 28

text: To cover for his motion, he pointed to a pathetic cloud of black smoke lifting over the palace.

text: That was our attempt to create safra.

text: Kyne thought he might know how but he didnt.
Name: Book 28

text: So I killed him, and its over.
Name: Book 28

text: That is very unfortunate.
Name: Book 28

text: Picard wrung his hands in front of him, grimacing a little at the discomfort of his bad arm.
Name: Book 28

text: Arent you still forgetting something.
Name: Book 28

text: Perhaps I am.
Name: Book 28

text: The sound of approaching soldiers grew louder.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean turned back to Picard with a sneer.
Name: Book 28

text: Go to hell, Picard.
Name: Book 28

text: He jumped from the bridge.
Name: Book 28

text: He heard the angry yells of Richard and his hordesfolk.
Name: Book 28

text: He felt a moment of victory as he sailed through the air.
Name: Book 28

text: Then he landed, and a jolt of pain shot up his leg.
Name: Book 28

text: He growled with anger as much as agony as he pushed himself onward.
Name: Book 28

text: Every step sent a hot sting through his calf.
Name: Book 28

text: He had to run anyway, which only increased his pain.
Name: Book 28

text: He heard arrows whistle through the air around him before he turned out of sight between buildings.
Name: Book 28

text: He had never wanted to escape like this.
Name: Book 28

text: It wasnt just Sean fleeing the palace, but also Chief Darius.
Name: Book 28

text: He thanked the fact that hed avoided the public eye while he stayed in the castle.
Name: Book 28

text: Even the Khans family had no idea that he was also Princess Fayrs favored suitor.
Name: Book 28

text: But people knew his name, and some might yet recognize him.
Name: Book 28

text: His tunic was covered with blood and his eyes were bright red.
Name: Book 28

text: He did not expect to ever return to this place, but for some reason, he could not bear the idea of Fayr knowing that the man who killed her brother was Chief Darius.
Name: Book 28

text: He wanted her memory of him to stay intact that way.
Name: Book 28

text: Caught suddenly with an idea, he pulled the Wolven mask from his tunic and placed it over his face.
Name: Book 28

text: He had stolen it from the wall on his way out.
Name: Book 28

text: The mask gave him a new surge of confidence, if nothing else.
Name: Book 28

text: People screamed and ran as he passed.
Name: Book 28

text: His leg still ached, but he managed to ignore it.
Name: Book 28

text: He would reach his horse soon.
Name: Book 28

text: He would get out of here.
Name: Book 28

text: He climbed when he got the chance, scaling a small building so he could spot the eastern gate ahead.
Name: Book 28

text: The problem with wearing the mask now was that he did not want Gregor to see him with it.
Name: Book 28

text: He used his whip to catch a bridge above him and swing to the next rooftop.
Name: Book 28

text: Then he saw two brown horses.
Name: Book 28

text: Gregor sat on one of them; the other was Seans mountain horse, complete with his saddlebags.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean pulled a shingle from the rooftop, aimed, and threw.
Name: Book 28

text: The shingle struck Gregor soundly in the head, who groaned and fell to the ground.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean stood and whistled to his horse.
Name: Book 28

text: The pesky creature made no response, but just left him standing there, looking like a fool.
Name: Book 28

text: An arrow sank deep into his thigh.
Name: Book 28

text: Crying out with rage, Sean pulled a throwing star from his tunic and flung it in the direction of the shooter.
Name: Book 28

text: To his brief satisfaction, the star found its target and the bowman fell to his death.
Name: Book 28

text: But this did nothing to ease the pain spreading up each of his legsnow both were injurednor the blood flowing freely down his knee.
Name: Book 28

text: He made one last jump to the ground, though the agony nearly made him crack his teeth from gnashing them, and then hobbled the rest of the distance to his horse.
Name: Book 28

text: Gregor was just coming to when Sean jumped onto his steed, slapped its flank, and sped away.
Name: Book 28

text: As he rode through the streets of Dearen, Sean pulled out his whip and cracked it from side to side.
Name: Book 28

text: The sound was effective in scaring people away, as well as driving his horse to run faster.
Name: Book 28

text: In little time at all, they had bounded out of the city and flew over the hillsides.
Name: Book 28

text: A glance backward showed him that a group of Vikand hordesfolk rode hot on his heels.
Name: Book 28

text: Most of them sat astride rams and goats that would never out-run a horse on flat land.
Name: Book 28

text: But what would happen when Sean reached the cliffs of Vikand.
Name: Book 28

text: Seans horse was good at climbing rocks, but it would never out-climb a goat.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean would not be able to, either, with both his legs injured.
Name: Book 28

text: He gripped the horses reins and leaned over its heaving shoulders.
Name: Book 28

text: He could do nothing but trust his horse.
Name: Book 28

text: He had never depended so much on another living creature to help him as he did right now.
Name: Book 28

text: He put one hand against its neck and felt the strength of its muscles thrusting forward.
Name: Book 28

text: This horse would lead him to safety, or nothing would.
Name: Book 28

text: Eventually, the darkness of the Shadowed Woods fell over them.
Name: Book 28

text: The quietude of the dense forest blanketed his ears.
Name: Book 28

text: For a brief while he heard nothing but the heaving breath of his horse and the rhythmic thunder of its hooves.
Name: Book 28

text: Then a snarl grated his earsfrom where, he knew notand the horse slid to a stop, rearing up and neighing with terror.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean barely managed to stay on the back of the beast.
Name: Book 28

text: He twisted the reins tight and searched the shadows in a frenzy for the source of the panic.
Name: Book 28

text: After first he thought he only saw the ripple of sunlight and shadows moving over the red soil.
Name: Book 28

text: Then he realized that in fact he stared upon a living creaturenot just one, but several.
Name: Book 28

text: The tigers of Dearen.
Name: Book 28

text: One of the tigers strolled into a shaft of sunlight, which alighted its fur as if with fire, and fixed Sean with golden eyes.
Name: Book 28

text: The cat hissed and swiped its paw through the air.
Name: Book 28

text: Seans horse turned and bolted back the way it had come.
Name: Book 28

text: Despite himself, Seans heart pounded with fear.
Name: Book 28

text: He had little doubt that if hed proceeded any further into the forest, the tigers would have ripped him to shreds.
Name: Book 28

text: In the past, the tigers had seemed like no more than decoration to the landscape of Dearen.
Name: Book 28

text: His horse carried him back out of the woods and into an open valley.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean knew better than to try turning it back around.
Name: Book 28

text: As much as he hated to admit it, he would rather face Richard than a pack of angry tigers.
Name: Book 28

text: He had little choice.
Name: Book 28

text: An arrow sank into his shoulder.
Name: Book 28

text: The pain overwhelmed him.
Name: Book 28

text: His horse bolted again, crazed with fear, and Sean fell helplessly to the ground.
Name: Book 28

text: The crunch of his body against the earth assured him that now, almost every part of his body was injured in some way or another.
Name: Book 28

text: Richards men fell upon him, wrapping his hands behind him with rope, then dragging him away to the happy cheers of their brethren.
Name: Book 28

text: Picard wanted some time alone time with their precious prisoner.
Name: Book 28

text: Richard just wouldnt give him the chance.
Name: Book 28

text: They camped in the valley and kept the prisoner in the khans carriage.
Name: Book 28

text: This seemed like a fitting place, somehow, to punish Sean for killing the khan.
Name: Book 28

text: Richard, unfortunately, would have killed Sean with his rage if Picard did not keep constant vigil.
Name: Book 28

text: He would let his brother visit Sean in little bursts, at which point Richard would kick and punch the prisoner as it pleased him.
Name: Book 28

text: Then Picard would worry about Seans health and talk his brother back out of the carriage.
Name: Book 28

text: Now Richard, he would say, we have a very important prisoner here, and we mustnt kill him yet.
Name: Book 28

text: We must make an example of him in front of all Vikand.
Name: Book 28

text: We must give him a public execution, and demonstrate for everyone what happens to traitors of the khan.
Name: Book 28

text: This will frighten them, brother, and best of all, it will make them afraid of you.
Name: Book 28

text: They will have to choose another khan, after all.
Name: Book 28

text: And who could they respect more than a man capable of killing a Wolven.
Name: Book 28

text: Richard would finally agree to leave Sean alone.
Name: Book 28

text: He would drink a lot of ale, pace about in the grass, and maybe spend some time with one of the Dearen maidens he had brought with him from the palace.
Name: Book 28

text: Then, he would resolve to go back inside and give Sean another beating.
Name: Book 28

text: This pattern cycled over and over and over again, until the night fell and the moon sagged low in the sky, and Richard fell asleep by the fire.
Name: Book 28

text: If you do not return to the balance immediately, then the price you pay for your transgressions will be very, very high.

text: She listened to the ticks of the clocks around her, noting how drastically their rhythms varied, how every clock clashed in a meaningless cacophony of sounds.

text: She had not tuned them of late.

text: She had not served as metronome to her kingdom.

text: Her emotions had taken control of her over the last few weeks.

text: Her feelings distorted rational thought, making it entirely illogical.

text: She could not decide how to move forward in her current state of mindnot when so much of her future, as well as Yamairs, depended on what she did next.

text: She barely managed to keep it down, then she waited on her hands and knees for the drug to take effect.

text: The potion worked more slowly than in the past, perhaps because it faced more opposition within her than usual.

text: Gradually, like a weight easing from her shoulders one pound at a time, the pressure of her emotions lifted off.

text: Her doubts melted away.

text: Eleanors deviations revolved around safra and Rebeka.

text: But Eleanor had brought them both into Yamair.

Name: Book 28

text: Rebeka engaged in fruitless activities, including consumption of safra.

text: Rebeka caused her to betray her husband.
Name: Book 28

text: Because of Rebeka, Eleanor could be subject to blackmail.

text: Because of Rebeka, Eleanor had ceased to see clearly what she should or shouldnt do.

text: Rebeka must be eliminated.

text: * By the next afternoon, Eleanor had tied up all loose ends.

text: She sat in the square of Yamair City surrounded by solemn gatherers, awaiting King Byrons appearance.

text: Drums beat steadily in the distance, matching the ticks and tocks of the clock-towers.

text: Tables of food lined the square, though not with the extravagance originally planned.

text: Eleanor had realized that such excess was far from wise.

text: She should demonstrate to her husband that the kingdom still produced adequate victuals, but not more than salubrity demanded.

text: Her original ideas of a grand feast hadlike so many other thingsbeen misguided.

text: Hastily, she pulled out more Discipline and swallowed it down.

text: Logical people did not feel impatience.

text: Rational thinkers did not feel regret for decisions they knew to be right.

text: And yet when the silence grew too heavy, or the pause between drum beats too long, she could still hear the echoes of Rebekas screaming.

text: Dont do this to me.

text: And thus she regretted nothing.

text: Send her far from Yamair, Eleanor had told the guardsmen.

text: She poses a dire threat to this kingdoms stability.

text: If she resists or if she ever tries to return, dispose of her permanently.

text: Congratulations on your new Prime Synergist, King-wife.

text: Eleanor turned to see a man walk into the open area of the courtyard.

text: People moved out of his way though he walked slowly and unobtrusively.

text: His appearance managed to startle her, if only for a moment, for Deragon had pulled back the hood of his robe, revealing his half-burned face to all.

text: The skin drooped grotesquely around his blue eye, and his lip seemed to curl with a permanent scowl.

text: Eleanor felt the trembling of the newly elected Prime Synergist, a young man named Ronald, just next to her.

text: He was the only one sitting with her at the royal table, as the king had not yet arrived, and the Scholar and not yet been replaced.

text: Congratulations, that is, if you made the right decision.

text: Deragon stopped in front of her, looming cruelly over the table, sneering down at their untouched food.
Name: Book 28

text: I know that I did, said Eleanor.

text: Discipline assured her of as much.
Name: Book 28

text: It allayed her anxiety and confirmed to her that Deragon should not remain Prime Synergist at all: not after he had defied her by staying overlong in Dearen, and especially not after implying a threat of blackmail.

text: The only lower statuses were the pinions and scraps of society.

text: It must be nice, said Deragon, believing without any sense of doubt that what youve done is the right thing.

text: Although I wonder, King-wife, if doubt is as precious a gift to us from the Earth Mechanic as logic itself.

text: For you see, I happen to know that your hasty replacement of me is going to come at a very high price: a price much higher than if you had let me remain in my post, which in fact would have been to your benefit.

text: Your perspective is appreciated, said Eleanor, though no longer of consequence, Cogman Deragon.

text: My perspective will have consequence, King-wife.

text: Of that, I can assure you.

text: King Byron returned to Yamair.

text: By the time Fayr reached the smoldering bodies in the dungeon, little remained of them but their stink, smoke, and ashes.

text: The chubby Gornum, who had never done anything worthy of his post as Master of the Royal Guard until now, saved her from self-destruction.

text: * Sir Gornum encouraged Fayr to stay in her chamber, and for once, she complied to his wishes.
Name: Book 28

text: Something had changed in Gornum since that morning, perhaps when the last of the safra in his system wore off.
Name: Book 28

text: He moved with a sense of purpose, even though his body was bulky and awkward, his gait imbalanced.
Name: Book 28

text: He reacted to every situation that arose with a sort of focus, even though he usually didn't know a solution.
Name: Book 28

text: Rather than giving up immediately or turning to Fayr for help, he actually paused to think about it.
Name: Book 28

text: Was this what it meant for people to live without the Haze.
Name: Book 28

text: She could not dare remain so optimistic.
Name: Book 28

text: Gornum seemed like an exception to most others, perhaps because of the responsibility placed upon his shoulders.
Name: Book 28

text: After coming out of his safra state, hed already witnessed most of his inferior guards die on the blades of the hordesfolk.
Name: Book 28

text: Hed seen chaos spread throughout the palace as the Vikandese gained a foothold.
Name: Book 28

text: Then hed heard that the Wolven had been spotted leaping over rooftops and even running between buildings.
Name: Book 28

text: The Wolvens appearance had worked somewhat to Gornums benefit, as the Vikandese withdrew from the palace in pursuit of the assassin.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayr attributed this reaction to the request shed made of the khan family, albeit obsolete, that they capture all Wolvens in order to win her favor.

text: Whatever Picards and Richards reasons, they had left Dearen city for now.
Name: Book 28

text: But just Sir Gornum had begun to feel like he might be able to breathe a sigh of relief, he and Fayr had discovered Kynes remains within the dungeon.

text: Fayr was grateful that she could place some hope and trust in Gornum at a time when everything else in her world seemed to flip over and crumble apart.

text: But Gornum wasnt enough.

text: Her brother was dead.

text: The Haze was gone.
Name: Book 28

text: Her small kingdom roiled with confusion.
Name: Book 28

text: And she might have had the strength to endure all this if Darius had been here to hold and comfort her, to help her through this.
Name: Book 28

text: Darius would never hold her again.
Name: Book 28

text: She stayed in her room for long many hours, even as the sounds of chaos reverberated from beyond, even as Gornum appeared periodically to update her on palace security or ask her for advice.

text: The day passed beyond her awareness, for she could think nothing, feel nothing: to feel anything at all would be too painful.

text: To Gornum she could offer no advice, no wisdom, no hope.

text: * In the morning, she met with High Chief Abrax.

text: The princesss summons astonished hima fact he did not try to hide as he sat with her in the Crystal Dining Hall.

text: Fayr found little reason to explain herself.

text: Coming from such a burly man with a jaw like a chisel, his voice was surprisingly soft.

text: Of course I will marry you.

text: To her surprise, it was the harpist, Jeevu, who helped her find the words she needed.

text: Ever since the storm that blew out the Haze, he had roamed the palace halls in a state of shock and misery.

text: He cried often, and she saw him a few times sitting and staring at his harp, unwilling to pick it up again.

text: Fayr passed him by each time, for she did not have the fortitude to offer words of comfort.

text: Until one day, she heard him playing his harp again in the Gardens of Delight.

text: She walked towards him slowly, picking her way through wilted violets and ferns.

text: He sat on a gilded bench, tears running down his cheeks as his fingers stroked the strings.

Name: Book 28

text: Together they wept, and at last, Fayr understood what she must say to her people.

text: On a golden noon, Fayr stood above the Royal Square of Dearen City.

text: The palace glittered behind her in all its crystalline glory.

text: The purple tendrils of her hair lashed the sky.

text: Below her, more people filled Dearen city than she had ever seen at once.

text: There were hundredsmaybe thousandsof desperate men and women filling the square, streets, and alleys.

text: People of Dearen, said the princess.

text: Her voice rang like a bell through the wind.
Name: Book 28

text: Every person in sight waited in breathless silence to hear her words.
Name: Book 28

text: For the first time in our recorded history, Dearen faces a great challenge.
Name: Book 28

text: We live without the Haze.
Name: Book 28

text: A soft sound, like a unanimous groan, passed through the multitude.
Name: Book 28

text: I come here today to tell you something, people of Dearen.
Name: Book 28

text: It is a great secret, protected by the Violenese for countless generations.
Name: Book 28

text: It is the truth behind safra.
Name: Book 28

text: The truth is that for centuries, the Haze has protected Dearen from harm.
Name: Book 28

text: But by doing so, it weakened us.
Name: Book 28

text: We grew dependent on its presence.
Name: Book 28

text: We took it for granted.
Name: Book 28

text: But worse than that, we ceased to understand pain or danger.
Name: Book 28

text: We let ourselves believe they did not exist.
Name: Book 28

text: We lived in a dream, Dearens.
Name: Book 28

text: And now it is time we woke up.
Name: Book 28

text: A murmur of discontent rippled through the crowds.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayr held up her hand, and they fell silent.

text: A cloud passed over the sun, sending a shadow through the city, as if upon the princesss command.

text: Now that you are awake, I have good news and bad news to share with you.

Name: Book 28

Name: Book 28

text: The rumors were true.
Name: Book 28

text: A Wolven infiltrated our defenses and killed my brother, Prince Kyne.
Name: Book 28

text: The congregation moaned with dismay.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayr struggled not to let a sob escape her throat.
Name: Book 28

text: I survived, however, she said hoarsely.
Name: Book 28

text: All of you here survived that day with me: the day the Haze disappeared.
Name: Book 28

text: We are still alive.
Name: Book 28

text: For the moment, our enemies have fled.
Name: Book 28

text: Perhaps Friva still blesses us, despite the absence of the Haze.
Name: Book 28

text: But we must not take our fortune for granted, as we took safra for granted.
Name: Book 28

text: We must learn from what has happened and move forward.

frame.Frame: Cause change of position on a scale

Name: Book 28

text: For that reason, I am proud to announce Here she choked, and it took her even longer to recover.
Name: Book 28

text: I am proud to announce my engagement to a Vikand chief.
Name: Book 28

text: We have not yet sealed the arrangement, but if all goes as planned, we will marry less than a fortnight from now, on the day of the winter solstice.
Name: Book 28

text: She did not know how it started, but somehow, the name of Darius spread through the masses.
Name: Book 28

text: She first heard it murmured not too far away; then she heard echoes of his name echo across the square.
Name: Book 28

text: Peoples voice came together in a chant.
Name: Book 28

text: Chief Darius, they said.
Name: Book 28

text: She wanted to faint with horror.
Name: Book 28

text: How did they even know about him.
Name: Book 28

text: Most had certainly never seen him, for Darius seemed to like his privacy.
Name: Book 28

text: But Fayr must not have paid enough attention to the rumors spreading during their courtship together.
Name: Book 28

text: His absence at the feast of Frivas Hall, it seemed, had not lessened him in the eyes of the population; in fact, it had increased their fascination with him.
Name: Book 28

text: A sob must have escaped her throat, loud enough to silence the chanting.
Name: Book 28

text: She struggled to breathe at all.
Name: Book 28

text: I did not say it was Darius, she groaned.
Name: Book 28

text: I believe that Chief Darius died defending my brother against the Wolven.
Name: Book 28

text: A silence more terrible than any yet fell over the mob.
Name: Book 28

text: I am in pain, as you are, said Fayr.
Name: Book 28

text: But this leads me to a new confession, for pain is not new to me.
Name: Book 28

text: Tears ran down her cheeks.
Name: Book 28

text: She could no longer hide them.
Name: Book 28

text: My confession is this: unlike all of you, I have never been able to feel the effects of safra.
Name: Book 28

text: Neither could my brother, nor my father, nor any of us with the Violenese blood in our veins.
Name: Book 28

text: This was one condition of a pact my ancestors made with the gods centuries ago that enabled us to make safra in the first place.
Name: Book 28

text: She remembered the words of her father, and her heart skipped a beat.
Name: Book 28

text: We made safra to control people.
Name: Book 28

text: Do you understand that, Dearens.
Name: Book 28

text: People will do anything to obtain happiness.
Name: Book 28

text: And if they are happy, they will not oppose the will of those who wish to control them.
Name: Book 28

text: This is how safra has protected Dearen.
Name: Book 28

text: But it is also how it has harmed you.
Name: Book 28

text: It has blinded you from understanding when you are in danger, or when you must protect yourself from harm.
Name: Book 28

text: It has led you to believe in a perfect world which does not exist.
Name: Book 28

text: It has also kept you from fully appreciating your blessings.
Name: Book 28

text: How can you appreciate anything if you do not know what it means to live without it.
Name: Book 28

text: The silence continued to hang over her people.
Name: Book 28

text: The shadow passed and sun rays poked back through the clouds, making the city glow golden.
Name: Book 28

text: We still have some safra left.
Name: Book 28

text: Do not waste it by consuming it immediately.
Name: Book 28

text: Collect it and give it to Dearen guards and reeves.
Name: Book 28

text: I will collect all the safra left and use it to rebuild this kingdom.
Name: Book 28

text: I promise you this.
Name: Book 28

text: For our kingdom needs rebuilding, and it needs a new form of protection than what it knew before.
Name: Book 28

text: We must build ourselves an army.
Name: Book 28

text: At this, a few people started shouting.
Name: Book 28

text: They were too far away for Fayr to hear them.
Name: Book 28

text: But their defiance must have given others courage, for soon more voices arose in anger.
Name: Book 28

text: You cant take our safra.
Name: Book 28

text: Youll leave us with nothing.
Name: Book 28

text: The people yelled and shook their fists, growing louder and louder.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayrs blood roared in her ears.
Name: Book 28

text: She had bared her heart to them, and she didnt know what else to say.
Name: Book 28

text: She had to do this.
Name: Book 28

text: It was the only plan she could think of.
Name: Book 28

text: She had to collect what safra she could and sell it to outsiders, or Dearen would have no source of revenue.
Name: Book 28

text: She would do it for their own good.
Name: Book 28

text: She would try to ensure that they had enough food and shelter, but just as importantly, that they worked for these things by equipping themselves for combat.
Name: Book 28

text: The fury of the crowd built and multiplied from one group to the next, spreading across the landscape.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayr didnt know how to stop it.
Name: Book 28

text: Then there came a scream.
Name: Book 28

text: The scream was so shrill that it cut through the shouts of anger.
Name: Book 28

text: Then more cries of panic waved from the same direction.
Name: Book 28

text: One section of the mob roiled about, as if trying to escape something.
Name: Book 28

text: People tripped and fell over each other in an attempt to gain refuge.
Name: Book 28

text: Then the crowd split apart.
Name: Book 28

text: A tiger walked amongst them.
Name: Book 28

text: As the great beast walked through the Royal Square, the panic subsided into a reverent silence.
Name: Book 28

text: They saw now that the tiger did not attack them.
Name: Book 28

text: Instead, it walked steadily towards the princess.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayr held her breath as the beautiful cat approached.
Name: Book 28

text: Its shoulders rolled with tremendous muscle.
Name: Book 28

text: Its golden coat undulated with its black stripes, shifting like the sunlight over the city as the clouds passed across it.
Name: Book 28

text: Its slitted eyes fixed her from afar and, just for a moment, she wondered if it came to kill her, as the tigers had killed many people in the last few days.
Name: Book 28

text: It jumped up to the platform on which she stood, and it took all of her willpower not to scream and run away.
Name: Book 28

text: The effortlessness of its leap was but a small testament to the strength of its body.
Name: Book 28

text: She had no desire to witness the relative power of its claws, which could probably rip her to tatters like so many knives.
Name: Book 28

text: But she could not run away: she would have to stand and accept whatever fate it intended for her.
Name: Book 28

text: The tiger stopped just a few feet away, staring at her.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayr noticed something strange about its eyes.
Name: Book 28

text: She had always thought tigers possessed golden eyes; she knew for a fact that she had seen some with such eyes in the past.
Name: Book 28

text: But the gaze of this tiger was different.
Name: Book 28

text: Its irises shifted with many colors, like a pool reflecting the spectrum of the rainbow.
Name: Book 28

text: Not unlike her own.
Name: Book 28

text: The beast walked a few steps closer, then rubbed its head against her leg.
Name: Book 28

text: It was a miracle Fayr remained standing, considering that her legs felt like jelly.
Name: Book 28

text: Then the tiger turned towards the people and roared.
Name: Book 28

text: The sound rattled the marrow of her bones.
Name: Book 28

text: Its volume carried across the horizon and shook the earth beneath her feet.
Name: Book 28

text: Horses and small beasts on the distant hills bolted in fear, scattering all directions.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayr wondered if the nations on both sides of Dearen heard her sound; for the moment she believed that they did.
Name: Book 28

text: When the incredible roar faded, Fayr no longer felt afraid.
Name: Book 28

text: She put her hand on the tigers head and wrapped her fingers in the thickness of its fur.
Name: Book 28

text: A rumble of approval vibrated from the cats throat.
Name: Book 28

text: If you defy me, said Princess Fayr, it is not my wrath you will face, but the might of your enemies.
Name: Book 28

text: Do as I say, Dearens, so that we might face this hardship together, and overcome those who wish to harm us.
Name: Book 28

text: Are you with me, Dearens.
Name: Book 28

text: Are you willing to face a life without safra.
Name: Book 28

text: Are you willing to fight our enemies if they dare test our strength.
Name: Book 28

text: At last, a cheer burst out of the crowd.
Name: Book 28

text: It began small, but eventually, more people yelled and clapped in agreement.
Name: Book 28

text: When the tiger roared once more, the people erupted with applause.
Name: Book 28

text: Fayr took a deep and shuddering breath.
Name: Book 28

text: A good cheer would not be enough to protect them for long.
Name: Book 28

text: But it was a very good start.
Name: Book 28

text: * Days and weeks passed as Fayr prepared for her marriage.
Name: Book 28

text: The wedding plans required great care and planning, for she understood now that her treasury and resources were limited.
Name: Book 28

text: She would hold another great feast.
Name: Book 28

text: She would share her remaining wealth of food throughout all of Dearen city.
Name: Book 28

text: She would even distribute a few small shares of safra, with the hope that ever citizen might enjoy a small pinch on that night.
Name: Book 28

text: She desperately needed everyone to celebrate this union.
Name: Book 28

text: If she could not be happy, then the people must be happy for her.
Name: Book 28

text: A few times, she received word from Chief Abrax that his preparations were going well, also.
Name: Book 28

text: As promised, he expected to deliver a thousand troops by the day of the winter solstice.
Name: Book 28

text: Vikand is in as much chaos as your own kingdom, High Chief Abrax wrote to her.
Name: Book 28

text: High Chief Richard wants to claim the office of Khan and Polemarch as his father did before him.
Name: Book 28

text: He has already led the Royal Horde against a few smaller towns who oppose him.
Name: Book 28

text: He has also imprisoned his own brother, Picard, calling him a traitor.
Name: Book 28

text: I have little doubt that if I take you as my Polemarch, my place as Khan is assuredor perhaps I should say King.
Name: Book 28

text: I look forward to the day, Princess.
Name: Book 28

text: Princess Fayr put away the letter with trembling hands.
Name: Book 28

text: Even though she harbored some hope for her upcoming union with the Vikand chief, a feeling of dread overcame her every time she thought of the wedding.
Name: Book 28

text: Preparations were underway, but she could not get excited.
Name: Book 28

text: High Chief Abrax seemed like a decent and powerful man.
Name: Book 28

text: Marriage with him would surely be better, she hoped, then marriage with Leonard Khan would have been.
Name: Book 28

text: But he remained a pale comparison to the man she wished to marry.
Name: Book 28

text: The tickle of tears on her cheeks alerted her to the fact she was crying again.
Name: Book 28

text: She seemed to do that quite too easily as of late.
Name: Book 28

text: She would have to relearn old habits soon, such as the ability to hide her own sorrow.
Name: Book 28

text: Although the absence of the Haze now allowed her to cry without alienating her people, she still needed to stay strong for them.
Name: Book 28

text: She needed to make certain sacrifices.
Name: Book 28

text: If she and her nation could survive the future ahead of them, she must dry her tears and find joy in a world without safra, for the sake of them all.
Name: Book 28

text: In the refuge of the forest, Sean faded in and out of sleep.
Name: Book 28

text: Whenever he awoke, he became all too aware that his body felt like a horse had trampled it a hundred times over, then dragged him for miles.
Name: Book 28

text: Perhaps Richards pummeling of Sean followed by Mina whisking him away made a near-exact comparison.
Name: Book 28

text: Minas rescue had come as quite a surprise, to say the least.
Name: Book 28

text: Sitting chained and battered in the khans carriage, Sean had felt ready to die.
Name: Book 28

text: He did not know what else was left for him.
Name: Book 28

text: He did not want to serve Belazar any longer.
Name: Book 28

text: Belazar wanted to take Fayrs life, and for a short while, Sean had even experienced the gods hunger for her.
Name: Book 28

text: He never wanted to feel that again.
Name: Book 28

text: But he could never escape Belazar.
Name: Book 28

text: The power of Belazar swam in his blood, oath or no oath.
Name: Book 28

text: His body was severely wounded; even if he escaped fever and infection, he would never move, leap, and climb as he once did.

frame.Frame: Cause change of position on a scale

Name: Book 28

text: Facing that tragedy was one of the worst fates he could ever imagine.
Name: Book 28

text: When Picard prepared to stab his eyes out with an arrow, he knew he would fight it.
Name: Book 28

text: His instinctsor perhaps Belazarwould never let him submit to such mutilation.
Name: Book 28

text: Despite all that, as the archon had loomed over him with the metal tip posed to strike, Sean thought this might be an appropriate enough way to die.
Name: Book 28

text: All this had run through his mind, then the red-headed maid rose suddenly from the shadows, striking Picard from behind.
Name: Book 28

text: She truly possessed stealth if not even Sean had noticed her invasion.
Name: Book 28

text: But there she was, and after she knocked out Picard with a rock, she fumbled through his clothes for a key, then unlocked Seans chains.
Name: Book 28

text: He did not recognize her immediately.
Name: Book 28

text: When he first saw her, she had been tied to Picards bed and dazed.
Name: Book 28

text: Her red hair had been long, past her shoulders.
Name: Book 28

text: Now, it looked as if she had roughly sawed it off with a knife.
Name: Book 28

text: But the way she glared at Picard, then spat on his unconscious body as she passed, sparked his memory.
Name: Book 28

text: Mina had helped him up and half-dragged, half-carried him out of the carriage.
Name: Book 28

text: In the light of a camp-fire, Sean saw most of Richards men slumped over, asleep, with smiles on their faces and glitter on their lips.
Name: Book 28

text: The maid must have used safra to subdue them.
Name: Book 28

text: Mina grunted under Seans weight as he sagged against her.
Name: Book 28

text: She pushed him to a line of horses and reached to untie one.
Name: Book 28

text: The beast nodded its head in acknowledgment.
Name: Book 28

text: Despite himself, Sean was relieved to see the horse alive and well.
Name: Book 28

text: Seans bags still hung from the saddle, although they appeared to be much lighter now.
Name: Book 28

text: Mina helped push him up, and after much heaving and awkward shuffling, he finally fell over the beasts back.
Name: Book 28

text: Mina led the horse away.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean became unconscious for awhile.
Name: Book 28

text: He was losing a lot of blood.
Name: Book 28

text: He felt the occasional sting of Mina pressing and dressing his wounds.
Name: Book 28

text: A few times he thrashed and shoved against her.
Name: Book 28

text: She would draw back until he fell asleep again.
Name: Book 28

text: Then she would resume her ministrations.
Name: Book 28

text: Eventually he woke up and felt as if his stomach gnawed through his flesh.
Name: Book 28

text: So she gave him bread and ale, and he ate to his hearts content.
Name: Book 28

text: He felt her staring at him, but he ignored her.
Name: Book 28

text: He huddled closer to the fire she had built and studied his surroundings.
Name: Book 28

text: They were on the edges of the Shadowed Woods, not too far from the cliffs of Vikand.
Name: Book 28

text: He shivered at the memory of the tigers he saw prowling before, but could only hope they remained elsewhere for now.
Name: Book 28

text: A cold wind rolled through the trees and rattled the branches.
Name: Book 28

text: Dead leaves scraped the earth and shriveled in the heat of the fire.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean drew closer to the flames and fell back asleep.
Name: Book 28

text: The next time he awoke, Mina sat across from him, studying him over the red glow of the embers.
Name: Book 28

text: Night was heavy upon them, the earth stiff with frost.
Name: Book 28

text: Sparks jumped and alighted in her gaze.
Name: Book 28

text: He stared back at her, realizing for the first time that he wore no lenses to cover his eyes.
Name: Book 28

text: In the light of the fire, they probably blazed redder than the flames themselves.
Name: Book 28

text: Who are you.
Name: Book 28

text: she asked at last.
Name: Book 28

text: How much did she remember.
Name: Book 28

text: I saw you back in the palace, she said.
Name: Book 28

text: You took walks with the princess.
Name: Book 28

text: Your name was Chief Darius.
Name: Book 28

text: He met her gaze again, glaring.
Name: Book 28

text: What good would it do to lie.
Name: Book 28

text: She knew his darkest secret.
Name: Book 28

text: The only thing he could do about it was kill her.
Name: Book 28

text: And in his current state, he wasnt even sure he could do that.
Name: Book 28

text: She paled with fear, as if sensing his thoughts.
Name: Book 28

text: Any enemy of Picards is my friend.
Name: Book 28

text: Besides, you were the one who saved me from him.
Name: Book 28

text: He bowed his head in acknowledgment.
Name: Book 28

text: He had almost forgotten about that.
Name: Book 28

text: It had been so very easy to set her free: just the slice of a rope.
Name: Book 28

text: He had merely been disgusted by what Picard seemed to be doing to her, and saw no reason to leave her trapped there.
Name: Book 28

text: What she did for him had been much more difficult.
Name: Book 28

text: But he saw no reason to point that out right now.
Name: Book 28

text: Talk to me, she said.
Name: Book 28

text: Even though she crouched close to the fire, she shivered from the chill of the night, or perhaps some other sensation.
Name: Book 28

text: A desperation cracked the solidity of her gaze.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean took a deep breath, feeling the ache of his ribs and shoulders.
Name: Book 28

text: He thought of how much he wanted to kill Richard right now.
Name: Book 28

text: In one sense that would make him feel better.
Name: Book 28

text: In another, the effort alone would hurt very much.
Name: Book 28

text: The only thing he could do about his anger was clench and grind his teeth.
Name: Book 28

text: What would you have me say.
Name: Book 28

text: I want you to tell me the truth.
Name: Book 28

text: I have spent most my life under the spell of safra.
Name: Book 28

text: When I first awoke from it, the first thing I knew was pain and fear beyond my wildest dreams.
Name: Book 28

text: I am confused and frightened by the world I see clearly now.
Name: Book 28

text: I cant go back to the life I knew before.
Name: Book 28

text: But I dont know what else to do.
Name: Book 28

text: I need someone to advise me.
Name: Book 28

text: Or someone, at least, to talk to.
Name: Book 28

text: So tell me the truth.
Name: Book 28

text: I just saved your life.
Name: Book 28

text: Perhaps you could say we are even, but could we at least try to be friends, too.
Name: Book 28

text: Her plea moved him more than he expected.

frame.Frame: Cause change of position on a scale

Name: Book 28

text: For someone who had grown up in the Haze, she seemed unusually aware of her situation.
Name: Book 28

text: He could only imagine how strange this new world must feel to her.
Name: Book 28

text: He had learned to protect himself from emotions a long time ago.
Name: Book 28

text: She, on the other hand, awoke in this terrible world with the heart of a baby in the body of twenty-year old.
Name: Book 28

text: My name is Sean, he said.
Name: Book 28

text: I am a Wolven.
Name: Book 28

text: Do you know what that is.
Name: Book 28

text: She shrank back a little further.
Name: Book 28

text: She seemed to understand well enough.
Name: Book 28

text: I am an assassin, he said.
Name: Book 28

text: But you  and the princess.
Name: Book 28

text: Mina shook her head helplessly.
Name: Book 28

text: I was Chief Darius, and I wasnt, he confessed.
Name: Book 28

text: It was a role I played while on a mission.
Name: Book 28

text: A role.
Name: Book 28

text: Her sharp eyes narrowed on him.
Name: Book 28

text: I saw you on your walks with the princess.
Name: Book 28

text: I may have been in the Haze at the time, but I know what I saw.
Name: Book 28

text: You didnt fake all that.
Name: Book 28

text: Her red lashes batted violently, as if the thought of this deception was too awful for her to accept.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean grunted with frustration.
Name: Book 28

text: Again, she seemed wise beyond her experiences.
Name: Book 28

text: I dont know, really.
Name: Book 28

text: Chief Darius began as a deception.
Name: Book 28

text: But while I was him, I felt.
Name: Book 28

text: He grimaced, clutching his aching leg.
Name: Book 28

text: Was there any part of his body not mauled and hurting.
Name: Book 28

text: I felt like I really was him.
Name: Book 28

text: Here.
Name: Book 28

text: Mina gave him some more ale.
Name: Book 28

text: She watched curiously as he emptied the flask, then threw it aside.
Name: Book 28

text: Who did you kill.
Name: Book 28

text: she asked after a brief silence.
Name: Book 28

text: He looked at her sharply.
Name: Book 28

text: Who were you there to assassinate.
Name: Book 28

text: Id  rather not say.
Name: Book 28

text: Mina sat up with a start.
Name: Book 28

text: Please tell me it wasnt Princess Fayr.
Name: Book 28

text: It wasnt.
Name: Book 28

text: It was the next worst thing, however.
Name: Book 28

text: He looked away from her, gnashing his teeth.
Name: Book 28

text: More ale, please.
Name: Book 28

text: I dont have any more.
Name: Book 28

text: They sat together for another long silence.
Name: Book 28

text: What are you going to do now that your mission is over.
Name: Book 28

text: asked Mina at last.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean felt tired now.
Name: Book 28

text: He wanted to go back to sleep.
Name: Book 28

text: But he sensed that Minas questions were far from over.
Name: Book 28

text: You cant go back to Vikand.
Name: Book 28

text: I saw how Richard and Picard treated you.
Name: Book 28

text: Fucking bastards.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean kicked the fire, throwing a slew of sparks into the sky.
Name: Book 28

text: The movement caused him pain, but he didnt even care.
Name: Book 28

text: You could stay here in Dearen, said Mina.
Name: Book 28

text: The tigers havent come after you yet.
Name: Book 28

text: Thats a good sign.
Name: Book 28

text: The tigers.
Name: Book 28

text: When I tried to flee through the forest, they chased me back.
Name: Book 28

text: That means they want you to stay.
Name: Book 28

text: What did the tigers have to do with anything.
Name: Book 28

text: But he could not find the strength to argue with her.
Name: Book 28

text: You could go back to Princess Fayr, Mina pressed.
Name: Book 28

text: You could try to live as Chief Darius.
Name: Book 28

text: Seans head was spinning.
Name: Book 28

text: Im going back to sleep now, he said.
Name: Book 28

text: And so he did.
Name: Book 28

text: Days and nights passed in a blur.
Name: Book 28

text: Mina came and went, sometimes for longer and longer stretches of time.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean fell once into a fever, and all of time seemed to tangle together.
Name: Book 28

text: The memories of all he had ever done played back in his mind with a garish visage.
Name: Book 28

text: The only memories he did not hate were those of Fayr and Chief Darius.
Name: Book 28

text: Minas words came back to haunt him.
Name: Book 28

text: Darius had been more than just a role he played.
Name: Book 28

text: Darius had been a part of himself, a part he had buried most of his life.
Name: Book 28

text: Darius arose to the surface only because of Fayr.
Name: Book 28

text: The fever passed, and his wounds began healing.
Name: Book 28

text: It would be a long time before they healed completely, if ever.
Name: Book 28

text: He did not think he would ever return to the full prowess he possessed before.
Name: Book 28

text: But perhaps he would regain the strength of a normal man.
Name: Book 28

text: Several times, he saw Mina practicing with a knife in the woods.
Name: Book 28

text: She looked as if she wanted to teach herself the arts of combat.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean watched her in silence from afar, kicking, punching, and swiping.
Name: Book 28

text: Then one day he burst out laughing.
Name: Book 28

text: She turned to him with a face red as beets, her eyes blinking with anger.
Name: Book 28

text: If you plan to hurt anyone with that blade other than yourself, he said, youd better learn to hold it right.
Name: Book 28

text: Then fucking tell me how.
Name: Book 28

text: He tried his best to tell her, although it was difficult without being able to show her.
Name: Book 28

text: It was the least he could do in return for the food she brought him and the care she gave him.
Name: Book 28

text: When he had the strength, he shared some of his knowledge with her about holding and swinging a knife.
Name: Book 28

text: He showed her his whip and his throwing stars.
Name: Book 28

text: She could not do much with the stars; they took years of practice to throw properly, and extraordinary strength to do any damage.
Name: Book 28

text: But she enjoyed cracking the whip all around her.
Name: Book 28

text: Despite all this, Sean sensed that Mina grew restless, and he knew their time together drew to a close.
Name: Book 28

text: One day as he dozed, he awoke suddenly to a tremendous sound in the air.
Name: Book 28

text: It reminded him of the grumble of the Great Volcano in Vikand.
Name: Book 28

text: But this was no volcano.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean realized belatedly that it might have been a tiger, but if so it seemed to transcend the state of beast as it roared with fury into the heavens.
Name: Book 28

text: The sound eventually faded and Sean tried to cast the incident from his mind, dismissing it as beyond his conception.
Name: Book 28

text: Nonetheless, it awoke the feeling in him that he needed to make a decision, and soon.
Name: Book 28

text: When Mina next returned to their camp, Sean broke the long silence between them.
Name: Book 28

text: He managed to stand up on both his feet, though it caused him pain, and walk a few steps towards her.

text: Sean retired to his chamber for the rest of the day, claiming he had work to do.
Name: Book 28

text: In truth, his leg hurt so much that he could barely walk on it, and his stomach refused to hold down any food.
Name: Book 28

text: His hands trembled and his arm spasmed, frequently and without warning.
Name: Book 28

text: He didnt know where Queen Fayr residedno doubt she truly did have work to dobut for once he was grateful she did not linger around to comfort him.
Name: Book 28

text: He did not want her to see him like this, and he did not want her to hear the details of his match with Sygmund, either.
Name: Book 28

text: Confined to his room and groaning over a bucket, Sean had all too much time to reflect on what had happened during the match.
Name: Book 28

text: The moment hed sprung up from the ground, pushing away Sygmunds sword and then grabbing his arm, hed had his old strength backor, more accurately, the strength of Belazar.
Name: Book 28

text: In that moment, hed subconsciously decided to kill Sygmund, and acted accordingly.
Name: Book 28

text: The resolvethe lack of hesitation, the freedom to hurt Sygmund however he couldhad made him feel like his old self again.
Name: Book 28

text: Then, when he had let Sygmund live, a hole seemed to open inside him.
Name: Book 28

text: The hole drained up all the strength hed temporarily enjoyed and then didnt stop draining.
Name: Book 28

text: He understood now that the hole would not be filled until he killed again.
Name: Book 28

text: The Wolvens made a living from assassinating people.
Name: Book 28

text: But they killed for a deeper reason than money alone, he realized now.
Name: Book 28

text: They were the children of Belazar, indeed.
Name: Book 28

text: Their own vitality seemed to feed from the life they took from others.
Name: Book 28

text: His father had once told him of Wolvens who even drank the blood of their victims to increase the strength of this exchange.
Name: Book 28

text: This was the gift and the curse of the god of wrath.
Name: Book 28

text: Murder fed them strength.
Name: Book 28

text: A life without bloodshed made him wither inside.
Name: Book 28

text: And he had gone a year without killing anyone.
Name: Book 28

text: He did not have the strength to turn and face Gregor right now.
Name: Book 28

text: The slave had gone through a lot of trouble to tend to his master today, and Sean appreciated that.
Name: Book 28

text: He also wanted to be alone.
Name: Book 28

text: He remained crouched over his bucket, turned away from the slave, while his stomach did somersaults.
Name: Book 28

text: I dont need anything right now, Gregor.
Name: Book 28

text: I thought you might want these back.
Name: Book 28

text: Something in Gregors voice made Seans blood freeze.
Name: Book 28

text: He turned and realized that what he heard in Gregors voice was satisfaction.
Name: Book 28

text: The slaves teeth were gritted with resolve.
Name: Book 28

text: His nostrils flared with excitement.
Name: Book 28

text: And in his upturned palm, he held two tiny brown lensesdiscs so small that Sean would not have seen them if he had not already feared their presence.
Name: Book 28

text: The two stared at each other in silence.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean considered his predicament.
Name: Book 28

text: He could kill Gregor now.
Name: Book 28

text: But then who would fix him tea in the morning.
Name: Book 28

text: What do you think youre doing with those, Gregor.
Name: Book 28

text: said Sean at long last.
Name: Book 28

text: Trembling, Gregor curled his hand around his prize, then lowered his fist to his side.
Name: Book 28

text: They were in the bowl you used this morning.
Name: Book 28

text: I didnt go into your bag or anything.
Name: Book 28

text: He said this last bit hastily, perhaps remembering how much he valued his fingers.
Name: Book 28

text: I found them  by chance.
Name: Book 28

text: But Ive always known you were hiding something, Chief.
Name: Book 28

text: Well, Ive guessed it for awhile.
Name: Book 28

text: And now Sean stood up and took a step towards him.
Name: Book 28

text: Gregor flinched and drew back.
Name: Book 28

text: What do you think you have found, Gregor.
Name: Book 28

text: Seans lip pulled away from his teeth.
Name: Book 28

text: Sean kept walking towards him, so Gregor kept moving backward.
